title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Granat M (2023). ggProfessional: Use GGplot2 Professional Way. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/MarcellGranat/ggProfessional.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ggProfessional: Use GGplot2 In a Professional Way},   author = {Marcell Granat},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/MarcellGranat/ggProfessional}, }

title: Use GGplot2 In a Professional Way
text: Based several years experience research, private public sector, package helpful regularly use {ggplot2} package perform daily institutional tasks. ggProfessional helps : exporting plots manage themes palettes add logo watermark figures

title: Use GGplot2 In a Professional Way
text: ggProfessional available CRAN, since satisfy requirements (saves wd, creates global variables work gg elements), built packages available CRAN.

title: Use GGplot2 In a Professional Way
text: load package, two functions immediately assigned global environment: - & .gg_finalise (hidden). -.gg taken following SW solution. allows use function gg object, without assigning . recommend add - .gg_finalise gg code blocks end, default return plot, without modification, later update .gg_finalise function, can specify saving method, used figures. Combine plot_to functions package, helps situations share figures also ppt/excel/csv.
code: library(ggProfessional) ls() #> [1] "-.gg" library(ggplot2)  ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Length, Petal.Width)) +    geom_point() - # <   .gg_finalise # no brackets! .gg_finalise <<- function(plot = ggplot2::last_plot()) {   plot_to_ppt(plot) # save all plots into one ppt file   plot_to_excel(plot) # save all plots into one excel file (as table)   plot_to_csv(plot) # save all plots into separate csv files (as table)   plot   }

title: Use GGplot2 In a Professional Way
text: Set theme ggplot figures already built ggplot2 package. field can extend register_theme/available_themes/get_theme functions. help save theme reuse projects.  Similarly functions palettes. set_palette create .co hidden function helps easily use palette (e.g. .co(1:2) returns first two colors palette, can also use named colors.). set_palette can also register colors default.  Note: set attach = TRUE, colors ggplot figures automatically updates palette.
code: register_theme(ggplot2::theme_bw() + theme(title = element_text(color = "red")), name = "rbw") register_theme(ggplot2::theme_minimal() + theme(title = element_text(color = "green")), name = "gminimal") available_themes() register_palette(c("red1", "#0c4853", "steelblue", "blue2", "green", "yellow", "#FF6F91"), name = "first") register_palette(c("blue", "purple", "cyan", "blue2", "orange", "yellow", "#FF6F91"), name = "sec") available_palettes() set_palette("first") .co(1:3) #> [1] "red1"      "#0c4853"   "steelblue"

title: Use GGplot2 In a Professional Way
text: can register institutional logos (saved locally) reuse every project.
code: register_logo(path = "logo.png", "ggp") # example #> [1] TRUE  ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Length, Petal.Width)) +    geom_point() +   watermark_logo("ggp", alpha = .2) ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Length, Petal.Width)) +    geom_point() -   corner_logo
